name: biomni-simulate-renin-angiotensin-system-dynamics
title: Biomni: Simulate Renin Angiotensin System Dynamics
description: Simulate the time-dependent concentrations of renin-angiotensin system (RAS) components using ODE-based kinetic modeling
content:
Overview

Simulate the time-dependent concentrations of renin-angiotensin system (RAS) components using ODE-based kinetic modeling. This specialized tool models the cascade of enzymatic reactions in the RAS pathway, including angiotensinogen conversion to angiotensin I by renin, ACE-mediated conversion to angiotensin II, and feedback regulation mechanisms critical for blood pressure and fluid homeostasis.

Input Parameters

  • initial_concentrations (dict, required): Initial concentrations of RAS components (angiotensinogen, renin, ACE, angiotensin I, angiotensin II, etc.) in ng/mL or pmol/L
  • rate_constants (dict, required): Kinetic rate constants for enzymatic reactions (k_cat, Km values for renin, ACE, and other enzymes)
  • feedback_params (dict, required): Parameters defining feedback inhibition (e.g., angiotensin II feedback on renin release)
  • simulation_time (float, optional): Total simulation time in hours (default: 48)
  • time_points (int, optional): Number of time points to record (default: 100)

Input Format

{
  "initial_concentrations": {
    "angiotensinogen": 1000.0,
    "renin": 10.0,
    "ACE": 50.0,
    "angiotensin_I": 5.0,
    "angiotensin_II": 2.0
  },
  "rate_constants": {
    "renin_kcat": 0.5,
    "renin_Km": 100.0,
    "ACE_kcat": 1.0,
    "ACE_Km": 50.0
  },
  "feedback_params": {
    "ang_II_inhibition_strength": 0.8,
    "ang_II_IC50": 10.0
  },
  "simulation_time": 48,
  "time_points": 100
}

Biological Use Case

This tool is valuable for cardiovascular and renal systems biology research including:

  • Modeling blood pressure regulation and hypertension mechanisms
  • Predicting effects of ACE inhibitors and angiotensin receptor blockers (ARBs) in drug therapy
  • Analyzing the impact of renin inhibitors (e.g., aliskiren) on RAS dynamics
  • Studying kidney disease progression and sodium/water balance regulation
  • Investigating tissue-specific RAS activity in heart, kidney, and vasculature
  • Understanding RAS dysregulation in cardiovascular diseases
  • Designing combination therapies targeting multiple RAS components
  • Modeling circadian variations in RAS component levels

Output

The simulation generates:

  • Time-course profiles of all RAS component concentrations
  • Angiotensin I and II dynamics showing cascade progression
  • Steady-state analysis of RAS equilibrium under different conditions
  • Feedback regulation effects on system stability
  • Sensitivity analysis identifying key control points for therapeutic intervention
  • Comparison of normal vs. pathological RAS dynamics

Results are saved to 'renin_angiotensin_results.txt' in the specified output directory.

Category
